newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares close lower on foreign selling.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares close lower on foreign selling.

text.p: Delhi shares increased losses to close lower on Wednesday as foreign investors sold selective stocks after some companies reported lower than expected profits, brokers said.
The Delhi bourse's benchmark index ended 8.81 points lower at 770.75.
Brokers said investors sold selective stocks, mainly of automobile companies, on expectations of an oil price hike.
"Shares of automobile companies were prominent losers of the day due to all round selling," said Ramesh Chander of brokers Baweja Financial Consultants.
Newspapers said on Tuesday that the government had tentatively decided to raise the prices of diesel and kerosene to trim a $1.5 billion subsidy bill, but the price of petrol would remain unchanged.
Reliance Industries ended 4.75 rupees lower at 291.90.
State Bank of India shed 6.05 rupees at 305.
Larsen and Toubro fell 2.65 rupees to 213.75.
